studyArms.name: Active Comparator A: Diagnosis by Molecular Testing
studyArms.description: Diagnosis and treatment based on the results of Urine PCR testing. Patients assigned even numbers on randomization table receive treatment guided by urine PCR results using KingFisher Duo Prime, QuantStudio 6 and 7 Flex Real-Time PCR System, and QuantStudio 12k Flex Real-Time PCR System.

studyArms.name: Active Comparator B: Diagnosis by Conventional Testing
studyArms.description: Diagnosis and treatment based on the results of Urine Culture and Sensitivity (C&S) testing. Patients assigned odd numbers on randomization table receive treatment guided by urine C&S results.

studyCohorts.name: Recurrent UTI
studyCohorts.characteristic: Patients with multiple occurrence (≥3) of uncomplicated or complicated UTI in past 12 months

studyCohorts.name: Underlying co-morbidities
studyCohorts.characteristic: Patients with metabolic disorder (e.g. diabetes), immunosuppression, or impaired renal function (e.g. chronic kidney disease)

studyCohorts.name: Functional and anatomic abnormalities
studyCohorts.characteristic: Patients with known functional and anatomic abnormalities of the urinary tract (e.g. stones, stents, recent instrumentation, indwelling catheters, neurogenic bladder, or polycystic kidney disease)

studyCohorts.name: Persistent infection
studyCohorts.characteristic: Patients with persistent infection after primary antibiotic therapy

epochs.name: Pre-screening
epochs.description: Recruitment and initial contact with potential participants

epochs.name: Screening and Baseline
epochs.description: Visit 1 (Day 0) - Informed consent, eligibility assessment, urine sample collection, randomization

epochs.name: Treatment
epochs.description: Visit 2 (Day 0 + 5) - Treatment initiation within 24 hours of test results becoming available

epochs.name: End-of-Study
epochs.description: Visit 3 (Day 28 ± 7) - Final assessment, urine specimen collection, clinical outcome evaluation
